amendment.description: Amendment sought to set aside $5 billion for a separate block grant program to fund crime prevention programs authorized in the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to authorize the Attorney General to allocate $1,000,000,000 from the funds provided in the bill for crime prevention programs for each of the fiscal years 1996 through 2000.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Conyers amendment (A011) Failed by voice vote.
